column4: How can I get the headphone jack on the front of my computer to work?
what make / model is the system?
are you going to answer my question, or not?
I did. The audio stuff is Realtek.
I didn't ask the chip, I wanted the mak and model of the system
I made it myself.
that's the answer I wanted
the motherboard is an eVGA p55 LE
gimme a sec
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh; chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh; ./alsa-info.sh
http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=4d35b6f751a34b69f13dd8800394bbbe23165323
is the front audio unmuted and cranked in alsamixer?
use M to unmute and cursors to move / change levels. Use ESC to exit
ok try adding: options snd-hda-intel position_fix=1    to /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf    reboot to test
alright, brb
no change
ok, remove the line. You may need to find an option for the motherboard, did you connect the fromt audio to the motherboard when you built the rig?
could press SuperL
hold it sorry
not sure, I don't use gnome desktop
lxde
